description: architectural double archway; trees in background
inscription:
Signature, Title, Inscription, Stamp and Label

on back, in pencil: [000047]
markings: LRC of image, stamped in black: [YB (?--monogram)]; on back, on label: [728]
medium: Pen, brush and ink, and graphite on paper
provenance: A. Beurdeley, Lugt 421 (1847-1919), Paris; sold lot 301, Nov.-Dec. 1920. [Eric G. Carlson, New York, until 1996; sold in July for PPOO, to Drake]; Harry Drake, St. Paul (1996-d. 2012; bequeathed to MIA)
signed: LRC, in pencil: [A Lepere]; LRC, in pencil: [Arc de Triomphe - Germanicus / Saintes.]
title: Triumphal Arch of Germanicus, Saintes
